intro: Govenia platyglossa, commonly known as the broad-leaved govenia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Govenia platyglossa is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
